class_notes: Course meets first 7 weeks of the semester. Grading Method S/U.  GH, GLEPI and GEH students through 11.03.  All others may enroll beginning after 11.03.
course_description: Over the course of the seven-week class, students will develop a grant proposal modelled after that used by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. Working in small groups of peers, students iteratively prepare sections of the proposal. Enrollees in the class will learn the following skills: identifying appropriate literature; formulating aims and objectives; selecting and describing appropriate methodologies; planning field work, timelines and simple budgets; clear and concise writing; and peer review. Individual class projects can be used as the basis for seeking funding for summer applied practice experience.
schedule_location: W 9am-11:50am in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R226
